topics.body:
Any momentarily triumph you think to have achieved with a discussion is in reality, a phyrric victory: The resentment and hate that you provoke are far more intense and durable than any temporary change of opinion. It is much more convincing to make others agreeing with you using actions, without saying a single word.

Here's what I mean. The main issue when trying to probe an argument or achieving a victory through a discussion is that in the end, you can't be certain how that will affect the one's you're arguing with; it may seem they politely agree with you, but on the inside they might resent it. Or maybe, when you say something that offends them; words just have the particularity of being interpreted according to the mood and insecurities of others. Not even the best argument has a solid base, because in the end, we all end up doubting of their elusive nature. And days later after reaching an agreement with someone, more times than none, we will always go back to our original opinion due to force of habit.
topics.author: 4fdfbf92945b7075d50036e4

topics.body:
So maybe I've been spending too much time on Tumblr lately - which will probably invalidate what I'm about to say - but there's something I'm confused about, and have been confused about for a pretty long time. People are accusing Katy Perry of being a racist because she wore a kimono on stage once and hung out with Kyary Pamyu Pamyu who, by the way, claimed to be a fan of her work. I'm failing to see the problem of wearing a kimono here.

I mean, from what I understand of their cultural origin, kimonos aren't the same as something like, say, a chief's warbonnet, in the idea that nobody had to go through bloody battles and other terrors for those feathers. It's cultural wear. What's wrong with wearing it; are people afraid that it's not going to receive the "proper" respect? Am I overlooking something?
topics.author: 5041b54f7f123b77af00a442

On some Skype chat I lurk there was a small campaign to elect William Howard Taft. And though he's a respectable man he is over a century removed fro current society and politics. So he'll probably end up being three times worse than any candidate from any party since he won't even grasp fax machines.

If there's going to be a mock campaign for silly reasons let there be Overlord Faust. She will be the closest we get to Mother Celestia and/or any one of the Mane 6.
